content: WASHINGTON, May 4 (Reuters) - Azerbaijan and Armenia have made "tangible progress" towards reaching a consensus in talks over the past few days, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Thursday, adding a final agreement was within sight.

Washington is hosting this week the foreign ministers of the two South Caucasus rivals. Tensions between them have flared anew after Azerbaijan installed a road checkpoint at the start of the Lachin Corridor, the only route linking Armenia to the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh territory.(Reporting by Humeyra Pamuk Editing by Chris Reese)
